含义: 乙 is the second of the ten Heavenly Stems (天干) in Chinese culture, often used to denote the second in a sequence. It can also mean 'second' or 'B' in grading systems.
字形: The character '乙' consists of a single stroke that curves from the top left to the bottom right, resembling a hook or a bend.
读音: The pronunciation of '乙' is 'yǐ' in Mandarin.
字源: The character '乙' originally depicted a sprout or a young plant, symbolizing growth and development. Over time, it evolved to represent the second in a series.
成语: 甲乙丙丁 (jiǎ yǐ bǐng dīng) - the first four of the ten Heavenly Stems, used to denote a sequence or order
例句: 在合同中，甲方和乙方的责任是明确的。 (In the contract, the responsibilities of Party A and Party B are clear.)
短故事: In ancient China, the ten Heavenly Stems were used to mark years, months, days, and hours. '乙' was the second stem, often associated with growth and renewal. A story tells of a farmer who planted his crops according to the stems, and '乙' years were always the most fruitful.
Another tale involves a scholar who used '乙' to denote the second volume of his works, symbolizing the continuation and growth of his knowledge.
诗词: 《天干》 - 甲乙丙丁，戊己庚辛，壬癸。 (The Heavenly Stems - Jia, Yi, Bing, Ding, Wu, Ji, Geng, Xin, Ren, Gui.)
《乙卯》 - 乙卯之年，春风吹又生。 (In the year of Yi Mao, the spring breeze brings new life.)
